definition: strong/powerful/better/slightly more than/vigorous/violent/best in their category, e.g. see 百強|百强[bai3 qiang2]
to force/to compel/to strive/to make an effort

horizontal/across/crosswise/horizontal stroke (in Chinese characters)/to place (sth) flat (on a surface)/to cross (a river, etc)/in a jumble/chaotic/(in fixed expressions) harsh and unreasonable/violent

sentences.english: Suddenly, a strong light cut into my eyes.
sentences.chinese: 突然，一道強橫的光芒直刺入我的眼睛。

sentences.english: And from the wicked their light is withholden, and the high arm shall be broken.
sentences.chinese: 亮光不照惡人，強橫的膀臂也必折斷。

definition: see 勢不可當|势不可当[shi4 bu4 ke3 dang1]
to be at the highest level of enlightenment (Buddhist expression)
to march straight in unchallenged (military) (idiom)/(fig.) to push deep into the heart of sth/to flood in
to take an alternate route (idiom)/to find an alternative/to take a different approach/to blaze a new trail
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
to turn a blind eye to
many men, a great force (idiom); many hands provide great strength/There is safety in numbers.
